verses.verse: Now these are the nations<WH1471> which Jehovah<WH3068> left<WH3240>, to prove<WH5254> Israel<WH3478> by them<WH3045>, even as many of Israel as had not known all the wars<WH4421> of Canaan<WH3667>;

only that<WH7535> the generations<WH1755> of the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> might know<WH3045>, to teach<WH3925> them war<WH4421>, at the least such as beforetime<WH6440> knew nothing thereof<WH3045>:

namely <WH2568>, the five lords<WH5633> of the Philistines<WH6430>, and all the Canaanites<WH3669>, and the Sidonians<WH6722>, and the Hivites<WH2340> that dwelt<WH3427> in mount<WH2022> Lebanon<WH3844>, from mount<WH2022> Baal-hermon<WH1179> unto the entrance<WH935> of Hamath<WH2574>.

And they were left<WH5254>, to prove Israel<WH3478> by them<WH3045>, to know whether they would hearken<WH8085> unto the commandments<WH4687> of Jehovah<WH3068>, which he commanded<WH6680> their fathers<WH1> by<WH3027> Moses<WH4872>.

And the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> dwelt<WH3427> among<WH7130> the Canaanites<WH3669>, the Hittites<WH2850>, and the Amorites<WH567>, and the Perizzites<WH6522>, and the Hivites<WH2340>, and the Jebusites<WH2983>:
and they took<WH3947> their daughters<WH1323> to be their wives<WH802>, and gave<WH5414> their own daughters<WH1323> to their sons<WH1121> and served<WH5647> their gods<WH430>.

And the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> did<WH6213> that which was evil<WH7451> in the sight<WH5869> of Jehovah<WH3068>, and forgat<WH7911> Jehovah<WH3068> their God<WH430>, and served<WH5647> the Baalim<WH1168> and the Asheroth<WH842>.

Therefore the anger<WH639> of Jehovah<WH3068> was kindled<WH2734> against Israel<WH3478>, and he sold<WH4376> them into the hand<WH3027> of Cushan-rishathaim<WH3573> king<WH4428> of Mesopotamia<WH763>: and the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> served<WH5647> Cushan-rishathaim<WH3573> eight<WH8083> years<WH8141>.

And when the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> cried<WH2199> unto Jehovah<WH3068>, Jehovah<WH3068> raised up<WH6965> a saviour<WH3467> to the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>, who saved<WH3467> them<WH6274>, even Othniel the son<WH1121> of Kenaz<WH7073>, Caleb<WH3612>'s younger<WH6996> brother<WH251>.

And the Spirit<WH7307> of Jehovah<WH3068> came upon him<WH8199>, and he judged Israel<WH3478>; and he went out<WH3318> to war<WH4421>, and Jehovah<WH3068> delivered<WH5414> Cushan-rishathaim<WH3573> king<WH4428> of Mesopotamia<WH763> into his hand<WH3027>: and his hand<WH3027> prevailed<WH5810> against Cushan-rishathaim<WH3573>.
And the land<WH776> had rest<WH8252> forty<WH705> years<WH8141>. And Othniel<WH6274> the son<WH1121> of Kenaz<WH7073> died<WH4191>.

And the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> again<WH3254> did<WH6213> that which was evil<WH7451> in the sight<WH5869> of Jehovah<WH3068>: and Jehovah<WH3068> strengthened<WH2388> Eglon<WH5700> the king<WH4428> of Moab<WH4124> against Israel<WH3478>, because they had done<WH6213> that which was evil<WH7451> in the sight<WH5869> of Jehovah<WH3068>.

And he gathered<WH622> unto him the children<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983> and Amalek<WH6002>; and he went<WH3212> and smote<WH5221> Israel<WH3478>, and they possessed<WH3423> the city<WH5892> of palm-trees<WH8558>.
And the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> served<WH5647> Eglon<WH5700> the king<WH4428> of Moab<WH4124> eighteen<WH8083> years<WH8141>.

But when the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> cried<WH2199> unto Jehovah<WH3068>, Jehovah<WH3068> raised them up<WH6965> a saviour<WH3467>, Ehud<WH164> the son<WH1121> of Gera<WH1617>, the Benjamite<WH1145>, a man<WH376> left-handed<WH334>. And the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> sent<WH7971> tribute<WH4503> by him<WH3027> unto Eglon<WH5700> the king<WH4428> of Moab<WH4124>.

And Ehud<WH164> made<WH6213> him a sword<WH2719> which had two<WH8147> edges<WH6366>, a cubit<WH1574> in length<WH753>; and he girded<WH2296> it under his raiment<WH4055> upon his right<WH3225> thigh<WH3409>.
And he offered<WH7126> the tribute<WH4503> unto Eglon<WH5700> king<WH4428> of Moab<WH4124>: now Eglon<WH5700> was a very<WH3966> fat<WH1277> man<WH376>.
And when he had made an end<WH3615> of offering<WH7126> the tribute<WH4503>, he sent away<WH7971> the people<WH5971> that bare<WH5375> the tribute<WH4503>.

But he himself turned back<WH7725> from the quarries<WH6456> that were by Gilgal<WH1537>, and said<WH559>, I have a secret<WH5643> errand<WH1697> unto thee<WH4428>, O king. And he said<WH559>, Keep silence<WH2013>. And all that stood<WH5975> by him went out from him<WH3318>.

And Ehud<WH164> came<WH935> unto him<WH3427>; and he was sitting by himself alone in the cool<WH4747> upper room<WH5944>. And Ehud<WH164> said<WH559>, I have a message<WH1697> from God<WH430> unto thee<WH6965>. And he arose out of his seat<WH3678>.
And Ehud<WH164> put forth<WH7971> his left<WH8040> hand<WH3027>, and took<WH3947> the sword<WH2719> from his right<WH3225> thigh<WH3409>, and thrust<WH8628> it into his body<WH990>:

and the haft<WH5325> also went in<WH935> after<WH310> the blade<WH3851>; and the fat<WH2459> closed<WH5462> upon<WH1157> the blade<WH3851>, for he drew<WH8025> not the sword<WH2719> out of his body<WH990>; and it<WH6574> came out behind<WH3318>.
Then Ehud<WH164> went forth<WH3318> into the porch<WH4528>, and shut<WH5462> the doors<WH1817> of the upper room<WH5944> upon him<WH5274>, and locked them.

Now when he was gone out<WH3318>, his servants<WH5650> came<WH935>; and they saw<WH7200>, and<WH1817>, behold, the doors of the upper room<WH5944> were locked<WH5274>; and they said<WH559>, Surely he is covering<WH5526> his feet<WH7272> in the upper<WH4747> chamber<WH2315>.

And they tarried<WH2342> till they were ashamed<WH954>; and<WH6605>, behold, he opened not the doors<WH1817> of the upper room<WH5944>: therefore they took<WH3947> the key<WH4668>, and opened<WH6605> them<WH113>, and, behold, their lord was fallen down<WH5307> dead<WH4191> on the earth<WH776>.
And Ehud<WH164> escaped<WH4422> while they tarried<WH4102>, and passed beyond<WH5674> the quarries<WH6456>, and escaped<WH4422> unto Seirah<WH8167>.

And it came to pass<WH935>, when he was come, that he blew<WH8628> a trumpet<WH7782> in the hill-country<WH2022> of Ephraim<WH669>; and the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> went down<WH3381> with him from the hill-country<WH2022>, and he before them<WH6440>.

And he said<WH559> unto them<WH7291>, Follow after<WH310> me<WH3068>; for Jehovah hath delivered<WH5414> your enemies<WH341> the Moabites<WH4124> into your hand<WH3027>. And they went down<WH3381> after<WH310> him<WH3920>, and took the fords<WH4569> of the Jordan<WH3383> against the Moabites<WH4124>, and suffered<WH5414> not a man<WH376> to pass over<WH5674>.

And they smote<WH5221> of Moab<WH4124> at that time<WH6256> about ten<WH6235> thousand<WH505> men<WH376>, every lusty<WH8082> man<WH376>, and every man of valor<WH2428>; and there escaped<WH4422> not a man<WH376>.
So Moab<WH4124> was subdued<WH3665> that day<WH3117> under the hand<WH3027> of Israel<WH3478>. And the land<WH776> had rest<WH8252> fourscore<WH8084> years<WH8141>.

And after<WH310> him was Shamgar<WH8044> the son<WH1121> of Anath<WH6067>, who smote<WH5221> of the Philistines<WH6430> six<WH8337> hundred<WH3967> men<WH376> with an ox<WH1241> - goad<WH4451>: and he also saved<WH3467> Israel<WH3478>.
